The video you were watching, **"These 5 AI Businesses Will Make You $1k+/Day (With Zero Employees)"** by **Wholesale Ted**, outlines five different AI-powered ventures that a single person can run with minimal or zero employees.

Here is a summary of the five one-person AI business ideas, along with the key AI tools and platforms mentioned for each:

### 1. Adult KDP Joke Books on Amazon

This involves creating and selling joke books as gifts on Amazon's Kindle Direct Publishing (KDP) print-on-demand service [00:23](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=23).

- **Concept:** Books targeting specific age groups (e.g., "Turning 60") that are printed and shipped by Amazon upon purchase.
- **AI Workflow:**

    - **Writing/Drafting:** Use the free version of **Claude** [02:42](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=162) for empathetic and high-quality writing, including drafting jokes.

    - **Design/Creation:** Use **Canva** [03:10](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=190) (drag-and-drop editor) to design the book's interior pages and convert them to a PDF for KDP.

    - **Marketing:** Use **ChatGPT** [04:33](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=273) to generate book titles, descriptions, and bullet points optimized for Amazon's search engine.

### 2. AI Tech Videos (YouTube Shorts)

The idea is to create and post viral, futuristic, or imaginary technology videos as YouTube Shorts to earn money from ad revenue [04:58](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=298).

- **Cost:** The creator estimates each video can be made for as little as 27 cents [05:27](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=327).
- **AI Workflow:**

    - **Brainstorming:** Use **ChatGPT** [06:48](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=408) to come up with cool AI tech ideas.

    - **Image Generation:** Use **Nano Banana** (inside Google's AI Studio) [07:00](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=420) to generate an initial image based on a prompt or a reference photo.

    - **Animation/Video:** Use the low-cost AI animator **Cling** [07:18](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=438) to animate the image or create transformation videos (e.g., a truck turning into a plane) [08:04](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=484).

### 3. Printable Party Games (Etsy)

This business focuses on selling digital PDF files of printable party games (like trivia, baby shower games, etc.) on marketplaces like Etsy [09:05](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=545).

- **AI Workflow:**

    - **Content Generation:** Use **ChatGPT** [10:22](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=622) to brainstorm game text and trivia questions.

    - **Fact-Checking:** Use **Perplexity** [10:40](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=640), an AI-powered search engine, to fact-check the answers provided by ChatGPT.

    - **Design/Creation:** Use **Canva** [11:00](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=660) to find an editable template, customize it, and save the final product as a PDF for digital sale.

### 4. Selling AI Art on Print on Demand (Etsy/Amazon)

This is the creator's personal one-person business, which involves generating unique AI art and selling it on physical products (like t-shirts, mugs, etc.) via print-on-demand apps [11:50](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=710).

- **AI Workflow:**

    - **Niche & Trend Finding:** Search marketplaces (Etsy/Amazon) for popular design styles [12:22](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=742).

    - **Brainstorming:** Use **ChatGPT** [12:48](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=768) to apply the popular style to a new, untapped niche.

    - **Image Generation:** Use **Nano Banana** [13:09](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=789) to generate the image design.

    - **Post-Processing:** Use **Canva Pro's AI tools** [13:21](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=801) to:

        - **Upscale** the image to high-definition for quality printing [13:52](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=832).

        - Use the **Background Remover** tool to make the background transparent [14:03](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=843).

    - **Sales:** Upload the design to print-on-demand apps like **Printify** or **Printful** [14:16](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=856) for automatic production and shipping.

### 5. Niche Background Music YouTube Channels

The last idea is to create long videos (1-2 hours) of background music (e.g., dark academia, space music) for specific niches on YouTube [15:43](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=943).

- **Cost:** The music creation is estimated to cost as low as 28 to 40 cents per video [16:10](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=970).
- **AI Workflow:**

    - **Music Generation:** Use **Sunno** [17:50](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=1070), an AI music generator, with a commercial license plan to create royalty-free music (500 songs per month) [19:15](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=1155).

    - **Prompting:** Use **ChatGPT** [18:15](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=1095) to help craft the specific song prompts for Sunno.

    - **Background Visuals:** Use **Nano Banana** [19:42](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=1182) to create a static background image or use the AI animator **Cling** [20:08](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=1208) to create a subtle, perfect 10-second looping animation [20:47](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bQOQnNfBG7A&t=1247).

> for each create detailed and descriptive informative narratives

Here are detailed, descriptive narratives for each of the five one-person AI business ideas, covering the concept, monetization, and step-by-step workflow:

### 1. Adult KDP Joke Books on Amazon

This business focuses on creating niche, adult-themed joke books to be sold as passive gifts on **Amazon's Kindle Direct Publishing (KDP)** platform. These books often target specific milestones, such as a friend turning 60. The entire process can be run by one person using AI tools to handle writing, design, and marketing for free.

**Monetization Method:**
The income is generated through **Amazon KDP Royalties**. As a print-on-demand service, you simply upload the finished book file, and Amazon handles the printing and shipping upon a customer purchase, deducting their costs and sending you the remaining profit. The video highlights how a creator with just four such books was estimated to be earning over $1,000 per day.

**AI Tool Workflow:**

1. **Writing/Drafting:** Use the free version of **Claude** to draft the book's content. Claude is noted for its empathetic and high-quality writing, making it ideal for creating engaging joke content.
2. **Design/Creation:** Utilize **Canva** to design the interior pages and the cover. This AI-enhanced, drag-and-drop editor allows you to easily add text boxes, graphics, and page numbers, then save the completed work as a PDF for KDP upload.
3. **Marketing:** **ChatGPT** is used for search engine optimization (SEO). By providing ChatGPT with the target customer, it can generate effective book titles, descriptions, and bullet points optimized to rank highly in Amazon's search results.

### 2. AI Tech Videos (YouTube Shorts)

This venture capitalizes on the massive engagement of short-form content by creating crazy, futuristic, or shocking imaginary technology videos and posting them as **YouTube Shorts**. Before AI, each video would have required an expensive animator, but now, the cost is estimated to be as low as 27 cents per video.

**Monetization Method:**
Income is derived from **YouTube Ad Revenue**. Popular channels in this niche can rapidly gain millions of views, with estimated earnings of $8,000 to over $12,000 for a single viral video.

**AI Tool Workflow:**

1. **Brainstorming:** Use the free version of **ChatGPT** to come up with unique and cool AI tech ideas for the videos.
2. **Image Generation:** Use **Nano Banana** (found in Google's AI Studio) to generate the initial, high-quality image that will be animated, often using a reference image for style.
3. **Animation/Video:** Use the low-cost AI animator **Cling**. You can upload the generated image and use a prompt to set the animation (e.g., stationary camera). Alternatively, you can create popular transformation videos by generating a starting image and a final, modified image (e.g., a truck with wings), and Cling will fill in the transition.

### 3. Printable Party Games (Etsy)

This simple, cost-free business involves creating and selling **digital PDF files of printable party games** (such as trivia, 'baby shower bingo,' or themed holiday games) on the online marketplace **Etsy**. This digital product model is highly scalable as the file can be sold indefinitely after a one-time creation. Some Etsy storefronts in this niche have been estimated to earn over $630,000 in just three years.

**Monetization Method:**
The income comes directly from **Digital Product Sales** on the Etsy platform. Customers purchase the file and print the game themselves, meaning there are no inventory or shipping costs for the seller.

**AI Tool Workflow:**

1. **Content Generation:** Use **ChatGPT** to come up with the game text and creative trivia questions tailored to the party's niche (e.g., a 70th birthday party).
2. **Fact-Checking:** To ensure the game's answers are correct, use **Perplexity**. Unlike ChatGPT, Perplexity is an AI-powered search engine that outlines its sources, allowing you to easily verify information.
3. **Design/Creation:** Utilize **Canva** to locate and customize an editable game template. You can switch out fonts, add free graphics, input the text from the previous steps, and then save the finished game as a PDF for sale.

### 4. AI Art on Print-on-Demand (Etsy/Amazon)

This is the creator's personal one-person business model, focused on generating unique AI art and selling it on physical products (like t-shirts, mugs, and homeware) through external fulfillment apps. The process begins with **data-driven trend-spotting** on popular marketplaces like Etsy and Amazon to identify in-demand design styles.

**Monetization Method:**
Profit is earned through the **Profit Margin** between the selling price and the cost of the product, printing, and shipping, which is all handled automatically by the P.O.D. apps.

**AI Tool Workflow:**

1. **Niche Brainstorming:** Use **ChatGPT** to take a proven, popular style and brainstorm how to apply it to a new, unique niche.
2. **Image Generation:** Use **Nano Banana** to generate the design based on the new concept and a reference picture of the desired style.
3. **Post-Processing:** Use **Canva Pro's AI tools** for critical post-production:

    - The **AI Upscaler** is necessary to increase the image resolution for high-quality printing.

    - The **Background Remover** tool makes the image background transparent.
4. **Sales/Fulfillment:** Upload the finalized, high-resolution design to P.O.D. apps like **Printify** or **Printful**, which integrate with marketplaces like Etsy and Amazon to automate order fulfillment and shipping.

### 5. Niche Background Music YouTube Channels

This business involves creating long, continuous background music videos (typically 1 to 2 hours) for highly specific niches (e.g., "Space Background Music" or "Dark Academia Music") and uploading them to **YouTube**. This is highly profitable due to the long watch times, which generate high ad revenue per user. The creation cost is incredibly low, ranging from 28 to 40 cents per video.

**Monetization Method:**
Income is generated via **YouTube Ad Revenue** for long-form content. This niche often reports a higher Revenue Per Mille (RPM), meaning a single popular video can earn thousands of dollars.

**AI Tool Workflow:**

1. **Music Generation:** The core tool is **Sunno**, a leading AI music generator. Its pro plan allows for commercial use, enabling the creation of up to 500 songs per month for a low monthly fee. **ChatGPT** can be used to generate the effective song prompts needed to guide Sunno.
2. **Background Visuals:** For the video's visual component, you can use the free **Nano Banana** to generate a single static image.
3. **Looping Animation:** To create a subtle, more engaging background, the AI animator **Cling** can be used to generate a **perfectly looping animation**. By setting the same picture as both the start frame and the end frame, Cling generates a continuous 10-second animation that can be seamlessly repeated for the duration of the 1-2 hour video.

> "Reviving Legacy: Project 2025's Blueprint for Conservative Transformation" "Echoes of the Past: How Project 2025 Builds on a Mandate for Leadership" highlights how Project 2025 is leveraging the successful strategies of the Mandate for Leadership Initiative. This initiative, which has previously aided conservative administrations in 1981 and 2016, demonstrated that committed conservative efforts can lead to substantial and lasting changes. The 1981 initiative, led by the Heritage Foundation, provided the Reagan administration with a comprehensive plan that resulted in historic tax cuts, military revitalization, and the fall of the Soviet Union, reshaping global dynamics. Similarly, the 2016 mandate guided the Trump administration towards significant policy actions like deregulation, tax cuts, and securing a conservative Supreme Court majority. > Here are detailed, descriptive narratives for each of the five one-person AI business ideas, covering the concept, monetization, and step-by-step workflow:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ### 1. Adult KDP Joke Books on Amazon
> 
> This business focuses on creating niche, adult-themed joke books to be sold as passive gifts on **Amazon's Kindle Direct Publishing (KDP)** platform. These books often target specific milestones, such as a friend turning 60. The entire process can be run by one person using AI tools to handle writing, design, and marketing for free.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Monetization Method:**
> 
> The income is generated through **Amazon KDP Royalties**. As a print-on-demand service, you simply upload the finished book file, and Amazon handles the printing and shipping upon a customer purchase, deducting their costs and sending you the remaining profit. The video highlights how a creator with just four such books was estimated to be earning over $1,000 per day.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **AI Tool Workflow:**
> 
> 1. **Writing/Drafting:** Use the free version of **Claude** to draft the book's content. Claude is noted for its empathetic and high-quality writing, making it ideal for creating engaging joke content.
> 
> 2. **Design/Creation:** Utilize **Canva** to design the interior pages and the cover. This AI-enhanced, drag-and-drop editor allows you to easily add text boxes, graphics, and page numbers, then save the completed work as a PDF for KDP upload.
> 
> 3. **Marketing:** **ChatGPT** is used for search engine optimization (SEO). By providing ChatGPT with the target customer, it can generate effective book titles, descriptions, and bullet points optimized to rank highly in Amazon's search results.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ### 2. AI Tech Videos (YouTube Shorts)
> 
> This venture capitalizes on the massive engagement of short-form content by creating crazy, futuristic, or shocking imaginary technology videos and posting them as **YouTube Shorts**. Before AI, each video would have required an expensive animator, but now, the cost is estimated to be as low as 27 cents per video.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Monetization Method:**
> 
> Income is derived from **YouTube Ad Revenue**. Popular channels in this niche can rapidly gain millions of views, with estimated earnings of $8,000 to over $12,000 for a single viral video.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **AI Tool Workflow:**
> 
> 1. **Brainstorming:** Use the free version of **ChatGPT** to come up with unique and cool AI tech ideas for the videos.
> 
> 2. **Image Generation:** Use **Nano Banana** (found in Google's AI Studio) to generate the initial, high-quality image that will be animated, often using a reference image for style.
> 
> 3. **Animation/Video:** Use the low-cost AI animator **Cling**. You can upload the generated image and use a prompt to set the animation (e.g., stationary camera). Alternatively, you can create popular transformation videos by generating a starting image and a final, modified image (e.g., a truck with wings), and Cling will fill in the transition.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ### 3. Printable Party Games (Etsy)
> 
> This simple, cost-free business involves creating and selling **digital PDF files of printable party games** (such as trivia, 'baby shower bingo,' or themed holiday games) on the online marketplace **Etsy**. This digital product model is highly scalable as the file can be sold indefinitely after a one-time creation. Some Etsy storefronts in this niche have been estimated to earn over $630,000 in just three years.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Monetization Method:**
> 
> The income comes directly from **Digital Product Sales** on the Etsy platform. Customers purchase the file and print the game themselves, meaning there are no inventory or shipping costs for the seller.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **AI Tool Workflow:**
> 
> 1. **Content Generation:** Use **ChatGPT** to come up with the game text and creative trivia questions tailored to the party's niche (e.g., a 70th birthday party).
> 
> 2. **Fact-Checking:** To ensure the game's answers are correct, use **Perplexity**. Unlike ChatGPT, Perplexity is an AI-powered search engine that outlines its sources, allowing you to easily verify information.
> 
> 3. **Design/Creation:** Utilize **Canva** to locate and customize an editable game template. You can switch out fonts, add free graphics, input the text from the previous steps, and then save the finished game as a PDF for sale.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ### 4. AI Art on Print-on-Demand (Etsy/Amazon)
> 
> This is the creator's personal one-person business model, focused on generating unique AI art and selling it on physical products (like t-shirts, mugs, and homeware) through external fulfillment apps. The process begins with **data-driven trend-spotting** on popular marketplaces like Etsy and Amazon to identify in-demand design styles.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Monetization Method:**
> 
> Profit is earned through the **Profit Margin** between the selling price and the cost of the product, printing, and shipping, which is all handled automatically by the P.O.D. apps.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **AI Tool Workflow:**
> 
> 1. **Niche Brainstorming:** Use **ChatGPT** to take a proven, popular style and brainstorm how to apply it to a new, unique niche.
> 
> 2. **Image Generation:** Use **Nano Banana** to generate the design based on the new concept and a reference picture of the desired style.
> 
> 3. **Post-Processing:** Use **Canva Pro's AI tools** for critical post-production:
> 
> * The **AI Upscaler** is necessary to increase the image resolution for high-quality printing.
> 
> * The **Background Remover** tool makes the image background transparent.
> 
> 4. **Sales/Fulfillment:** Upload the finalized, high-resolution design to P.O.D. apps like **Printify** or **Printful**, which integrate with marketplaces like Etsy and Amazon to automate order fulfillment and shipping.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ### 5. Niche Background Music YouTube Channels
> 
> This business involves creating long, continuous background music videos (typically 1 to 2 hours) for highly specific niches (e.g., "Space Background Music" or "Dark Academia Music") and uploading them to **YouTube**. This is highly profitable due to the long watch times, which generate high ad revenue per user. The creation cost is incredibly low, ranging from 28 to 40 cents per video.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Monetization Method:**
> 
> Income is generated via **YouTube Ad Revenue** for long-form content. This niche often reports a higher Revenue Per Mille (RPM), meaning a single popular video can earn thousands of dollars.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **AI Tool Workflow:**
> 
> 1. **Music Generation:** The core tool is **Sunno**, a leading AI music generator. Its pro plan allows for commercial use, enabling the creation of up to 500 songs per month for a low monthly fee. **ChatGPT** can be used to generate the effective song prompts needed to guide Sunno.
> 
> 2. **Background Visuals:** For the video's visual component, you can use the free **Nano Banana** to generate a single static image.
> 
> 3. **Looping Animation:** To create a subtle, more engaging background, the AI animator **Cling** can be used to generate a **perfectly looping animation**. By setting the same picture as both the start frame and the end frame, Cling generates a continuous 10-second animation that can be seamlessly repeated for the duration of the 1-2 hour video.

>

> 3. **Introduction (150-200 words):**
> 
> * **Hook:** Start with a statistic or a bold claim addressing the audience's main pain point.

> * **Thesis:** Clearly state the post's unique value proposition (UVP).

> 4. **Content Body (1,200-2,000 words):**
> 
> * Use a minimum of five $\mathbf{H2}$ headers. All $\mathbf{H2}$ headers must be **question-based** and include either the primary or an LSI keyword (targeting "People Also Ask").

> * Use $\mathbf{H3}$ headers for sub-points.

> * **E-E-A-T:** Integrate specific, verifiable data points, mention relevant **expert sources/studies**, or cite **personal experience/case studies** to build authority and trustworthiness.

> * **Internal Linking:** Naturally weave in three distinct opportunities for internal links to supporting articles/pages on **[YOUR WEBSITE DOMAIN]**.

> 5. **FAQ Section (targeting PAA):** Create a dedicated section with 3-5 short Q&A pairs directly answering LSI-driven questions.
> 
> 6. **Conclusion (100-150 words):** Summarize the main value proposition, restate the core benefit, and transition smoothly to the CTA.

> 7. **Call-to-Action (CTA):** End with a **clear, single-focus, conversion-driving CTA** (e.g., "Download our free checklist," "Book a demo," "Subscribe to the newsletter").

> Here are detailed, descriptive narratives for each of the five one-person AI business ideas, covering the concept, monetization, and step-by-step workflow:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ### 1. Adult KDP Joke Books on Amazon
> 
> This business focuses on creating niche, adult-themed joke books to be sold as passive gifts on **Amazon's Kindle Direct Publishing (KDP)** platform. These books often target specific milestones, such as a friend turning 60. The entire process can be run by one person using AI tools to handle writing, design, and marketing for free.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Monetization Method:**
> 
> The income is generated through **Amazon KDP Royalties**. As a print-on-demand service, you simply upload the finished book file, and Amazon handles the printing and shipping upon a customer purchase, deducting their costs and sending you the remaining profit. The video highlights how a creator with just four such books was estimated to be earning over $1,000 per day.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **AI Tool Workflow:**
> 
> 1. **Writing/Drafting:** Use the free version of **Claude** to draft the book's content. Claude is noted for its empathetic and high-quality writing, making it ideal for creating engaging joke content.
> 
> 2. **Design/Creation:** Utilize **Canva** to design the interior pages and the cover. This AI-enhanced, drag-and-drop editor allows you to easily add text boxes, graphics, and page numbers, then save the completed work as a PDF for KDP upload.
> 
> 3. **Marketing:** **ChatGPT** is used for search engine optimization (SEO). By providing ChatGPT with the target customer, it can generate effective book titles, descriptions, and bullet points optimized to rank highly in Amazon's search results.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ### 2. AI Tech Videos (YouTube Shorts)
> 
> This venture capitalizes on the massive engagement of short-form content by creating crazy, futuristic, or shocking imaginary technology videos and posting them as **YouTube Shorts**. Before AI, each video would have required an expensive animator, but now, the cost is estimated to be as low as 27 cents per video.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Monetization Method:**
> 
> Income is derived from **YouTube Ad Revenue**. Popular channels in this niche can rapidly gain millions of views, with estimated earnings of $8,000 to over $12,000 for a single viral video.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **AI Tool Workflow:**
> 
> 1. **Brainstorming:** Use the free version of **ChatGPT** to come up with unique and cool AI tech ideas for the videos.
> 
> 2. **Image Generation:** Use **Nano Banana** (found in Google's AI Studio) to generate the initial, high-quality image that will be animated, often using a reference image for style.
> 
> 3. **Animation/Video:** Use the low-cost AI animator **Cling**. You can upload the generated image and use a prompt to set the animation (e.g., stationary camera). Alternatively, you can create popular transformation videos by generating a starting image and a final, modified image (e.g., a truck with wings), and Cling will fill in the transition.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ### 3. Printable Party Games (Etsy)
> 
> This simple, cost-free business involves creating and selling **digital PDF files of printable party games** (such as trivia, 'baby shower bingo,' or themed holiday games) on the online marketplace **Etsy**. This digital product model is highly scalable as the file can be sold indefinitely after a one-time creation. Some Etsy storefronts in this niche have been estimated to earn over $630,000 in just three years.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Monetization Method:**
> 
> The income comes directly from **Digital Product Sales** on the Etsy platform. Customers purchase the file and print the game themselves, meaning there are no inventory or shipping costs for the seller.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **AI Tool Workflow:**
> 
> 1. **Content Generation:** Use **ChatGPT** to come up with the game text and creative trivia questions tailored to the party's niche (e.g., a 70th birthday party).
> 
> 2. **Fact-Checking:** To ensure the game's answers are correct, use **Perplexity**. Unlike ChatGPT, Perplexity is an AI-powered search engine that outlines its sources, allowing you to easily verify information.
> 
> 3. **Design/Creation:** Utilize **Canva** to locate and customize an editable game template. You can switch out fonts, add free graphics, input the text from the previous steps, and then save the finished game as a PDF for sale.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ### 4. AI Art on Print-on-Demand (Etsy/Amazon)
> 
> This is the creator's personal one-person business model, focused on generating unique AI art and selling it on physical products (like t-shirts, mugs, and homeware) through external fulfillment apps. The process begins with **data-driven trend-spotting** on popular marketplaces like Etsy and Amazon to identify in-demand design styles.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Monetization Method:**
> 
> Profit is earned through the **Profit Margin** between the selling price and the cost of the product, printing, and shipping, which is all handled automatically by the P.O.D. apps.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **AI Tool Workflow:**
> 
> 1. **Niche Brainstorming:** Use **ChatGPT** to take a proven, popular style and brainstorm how to apply it to a new, unique niche.
> 
> 2. **Image Generation:** Use **Nano Banana** to generate the design based on the new concept and a reference picture of the desired style.
> 
> 3. **Post-Processing:** Use **Canva Pro's AI tools** for critical post-production:
> 
> * The **AI Upscaler** is necessary to increase the image resolution for high-quality printing.
> 
> * The **Background Remover** tool makes the image background transparent.
> 
> 4. **Sales/Fulfillment:** Upload the finalized, high-resolution design to P.O.D. apps like **Printify** or **Printful**, which integrate with marketplaces like Etsy and Amazon to automate order fulfillment and shipping.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ### 5. Niche Background Music YouTube Channels
> 
> This business involves creating long, continuous background music videos (typically 1 to 2 hours) for highly specific niches (e.g., "Space Background Music" or "Dark Academia Music") and uploading them to **YouTube**. This is highly profitable due to the long watch times, which generate high ad revenue per user. The creation cost is incredibly low, ranging from 28 to 40 cents per video.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Monetization Method:**
> 
> Income is generated via **YouTube Ad Revenue** for long-form content. This niche often reports a higher Revenue Per Mille (RPM), meaning a single popular video can earn thousands of dollars.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **AI Tool Workflow:**
> 
> 1. **Music Generation:** The core tool is **Sunno**, a leading AI music generator. Its pro plan allows for commercial use, enabling the creation of up to 500 songs per month for a low monthly fee. **ChatGPT** can be used to generate the effective song prompts needed to guide Sunno.
> 
> 2. **Background Visuals:** For the video's visual component, you can use the free **Nano Banana** to generate a single static image.
> 
> 3. **Looping Animation:** To create a subtle, more engaging background, the AI animator **Cling** can be used to generate a **perfectly looping animation**. By setting the same picture as both the start frame and the end frame, Cling generates a continuous 10-second animation that can be seamlessly repeated for the duration of the 1-2 hour video.

>

> 3. **Introduction (150-200 words):**
> 
> * **Hook:** Start with a statistic or a bold claim addressing the audience's main pain point.

> * **Thesis:** Clearly state the post's unique value proposition (UVP).

> 4. **Content Body (1,200-2,000 words):**
> 
> * Use a minimum of five $\mathbf{H2}$ headers. All $\mathbf{H2}$ headers must be **question-based** and include either the primary or an LSI keyword (targeting "People Also Ask").

> * Use $\mathbf{H3}$ headers for sub-points.

> * **E-E-A-T:** Integrate specific, verifiable data points, mention relevant **expert sources/studies**, or cite **personal experience/case studies** to build authority and trustworthiness.

> * **Internal Linking:** Naturally weave in three distinct opportunities for internal links to supporting articles/pages on **[YOUR WEBSITE DOMAIN]**.

> 5. **FAQ Section (targeting PAA):** Create a dedicated section with 3-5 short Q&A pairs directly answering LSI-driven questions.
> 
> 6. **Conclusion (100-150 words):** Summarize the main value proposition, restate the core benefit, and transition smoothly to the CTA.

> 7. **Call-to-Action (CTA):** End with a **clear, single-focus, conversion-driving CTA** (e.g., "Download our free checklist," "Book a demo," "Subscribe to the newsletter").

> /* --- Dialog & Color Picker Styles --- */
> 
> .custom-dialog-overlay { position: fixed; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background-color: rgba(34, 34, 34, 0.75); z-index: 1000000; display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center; }
> 
> .custom-dialog-box { background-color: #333333; padding: 25px; border-radius: 12px; box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); text-align: center; max-width: 400px; border: 1px solid var(--surface-4); }

> .dialog-btn-cancel { background-color: var(--surface-4); color: var(--on-surface); }

> .custom-dialog-input { width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 10px; border-radius: 8px; border: 1px solid var(--surface-4); background-color: var(--surface-1); color: var(--on-surface); font-size: 16px; margin-bottom: 20px; }
> 
> .color-picker-grid { display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(5, 1fr); gap: 10px; margin-bottom: 20px; }
> 
> .color-picker-dialog .color-swatch { width: 32px; height: 32px; border-radius: 50%; cursor: pointer; border: 2px solid transparent; position: relative; }
> 
> .color-picker-dialog .color-swatch:hover { border: 2px solid var(--on-primary-surface); }
> 
> .color-picker-dialog .color-swatch.selected::after { content: ""; position: absolute; inset: 0; border: 3px solid #fff; border-radius: 50%; box-sizing: border-box; pointer-events: none; }
> 
> `;

> // --- Core Functions ---
> 
> 
> 
> 
> function injectCustomCSS() {
> 
> try {
> 
> GM_addStyle(embeddedCSS);
> 
> } catch (error) {
> 
> console.error("Gemini Mod Userscript: Failed to inject custom CSS:", error);
> 
> const style = document.createElement('style');
> 
> style.textContent = embeddedCSS;
> 
> document.head.appendChild(style);
> 
> }
> 
> }

> 
> 
> 
> function displayUserscriptMessage(message, isError = true) {
> 
> const prefix = "Gemini Mod Userscript: ";
> 
> if (isError) console.error(prefix + message);
> 
> else console.log(prefix + message);
> 
> alert(prefix + message);
> 
> }

> 
> 
> function clearElement(element) {
> 
> if (element) {
> 
> while (element.firstChild) {
> 
> element.removeChild(element.firstChild);
> 
> }
> 
> }
> 
> }

> // --- Text Insertion Logic ---
> 
> 
> 
> 
> function findTargetInputElement() {
> 
> for (const selector of GEMINI_INPUT_FIELD_SELECTORS) {
> 
> const element = document.querySelector(selector);
> 
> if (element) {
> 
> return element.classList.contains('ql-editor') ? (element.querySelector('p') || element) : element;
> 
> }
> 
> }
> 
> return null;
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> function insertSnippetText(textToInsert) {
> 
> const target = findTargetInputElement();
> 
> if (!target) {
> 
> displayUserscriptMessage("Could not find Gemini input field.");
> 
> return;
> 
> }
> 
> target.focus();
> 
> setTimeout(() => {
> 
> try {
> 
> document.execCommand('insertText', false, textToInsert);
> 
> } catch (e) {
> 
> console.warn("Gemini Mod: execCommand failed, falling back to textContent.", e);
> 
> target.textContent += textToInsert;
> 
> }
> 
> target.dispatchEvent(new Event('input', { bubbles: true, cancelable: true }));
> 
> }, 50);
> 
> }
> 
>

> // --- Configuration Management ---
> 
> 
> 
> 
> async function loadConfiguration() {
> 
> try {
> 
> // Toolbar items
> 
> const savedToolbarItems = await GM_getValue(STORAGE_KEY_TOOLBAR_ITEMS);
> 
> toolbarItems = savedToolbarItems ? JSON.parse(savedToolbarItems) : defaultToolbarItems;
> 
> // Folder items
> 
> folders = await GM_getValue(STORAGE_KEY_FOLDERS, []);
> 
> conversationFolders = await GM_getValue(STORAGE_KEY_CONVO_FOLDERS, {});
> 
> } catch (e) {
> 
> console.error("Gemini Mod: Error loading configuration, using defaults.", e);
> 
> toolbarItems = defaultToolbarItems;
> 
> folders = [];
> 
> conversationFolders = {};
> 
> }
> 
> }

> 
> 
> async function saveToolbarConfiguration() {
> 
> const settingsPanel = document.getElementById('gemini-mod-settings-panel');
> 
> if (!settingsPanel) return;
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const newItems = [];
> 
> settingsPanel.querySelectorAll('#toolbar-items-container > .item-group').forEach(group => {
> 
> const type = group.dataset.type;
> 
> if (type === 'button') {
> 
> const label = group.querySelector('.label-input').value.trim();
> 
> const text = group.querySelector('.text-input').value;
> 
> if (label) newItems.push({ type, label, text });
> 
> } else if (type === 'dropdown') {
> 
> const placeholder = group.querySelector('.placeholder-input').value.trim();
> 
> const options = [];
> 
> group.querySelectorAll('.option-item').forEach(opt => {
> 
> const label = opt.querySelector('.label-input').value.trim();
> 
> const text = opt.querySelector('.text-input').value;
> 
> if (label) options.push({ label, text });
> 
> });
> 
> if (placeholder && options.length > 0) {
> 
> newItems.push({ type, placeholder, options });
> 
> }
> 
> }
> 
> });
> 
> 
> 
> 
> try {
> 
> await GM_setValue(STORAGE_KEY_TOOLBAR_ITEMS, JSON.stringify(newItems));
> 
> await loadConfiguration(); // Reload all configs
> 
> rebuildToolbar();
> 
> toggleSettingsPanel(false);
> 
> } catch (e) {
> 
> displayUserscriptMessage("Failed to save settings. See console for details.");
> 
> console.error("Gemini Mod: Error saving settings:", e);
> 
> }
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> async function saveFolderConfiguration() {
> 
> await GM_setValue(STORAGE_KEY_FOLDERS, folders);
> 
> await GM_setValue(STORAGE_KEY_CONVO_FOLDERS, conversationFolders);
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
>

> // --- Toolbar Creation ---
> 
> 
> 
> 
> function createToolbar() {
> 
> const toolbarId = 'gemini-snippet-toolbar-userscript';
> 
> let toolbar = document.getElementById(toolbarId);
> 
> if (toolbar) {
> 
> clearElement(toolbar);
> 
> } else {
> 
> toolbar = document.createElement('div');
> 
> toolbar.id = toolbarId;
> 
> document.body.insertBefore(toolbar, document.body.firstChild);
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> toolbarItems.forEach(item => {
> 
> if (item.type === 'button') {
> 
> const button = document.createElement('button');
> 
> button.textContent = item.label;
> 
> button.title = item.text;
> 
> button.addEventListener('click', () => insertSnippetText(item.text));
> 
> toolbar.appendChild(button);
> 
> } else if (item.type === 'dropdown') {
> 
> const select = document.createElement('select');
> 
> select.title = item.placeholder;
> 
> const defaultOption = new Option(item.placeholder, "", true, true);
> 
> defaultOption.disabled = true;
> 
> select.appendChild(defaultOption);
> 
> item.options.forEach(opt => select.appendChild(new Option(opt.label, opt.text)));
> 
> select.addEventListener('change', (e) => {
> 
> if (e.target.value) {
> 
> insertSnippetText(e.target.value);
> 
> e.target.selectedIndex = 0;
> 
> }
> 
> });
> 
> toolbar.appendChild(select);
> 
> }
> 
> });
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const spacer = document.createElement('div');
> 
> spacer.className = 'userscript-toolbar-spacer';
> 
> toolbar.appendChild(spacer);
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const pasteButton = document.createElement('button');
> 
> pasteButton.textContent = PASTE_BUTTON_LABEL;
> 
> pasteButton.title = "Paste from Clipboard";
> 
> pasteButton.addEventListener('click', async () => {
> 
> try {
> 
> const text = await navigator.clipboard.readText();
> 
> if (text) insertSnippetText(text);
> 
> } catch (err) {
> 
> displayUserscriptMessage('Failed to read clipboard: ' + err.message);
> 
> }
> 
> });
> 
> toolbar.appendChild(pasteButton);
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const downloadButton = document.createElement('button');
> 
> downloadButton.textContent = DOWNLOAD_BUTTON_LABEL;
> 
> downloadButton.title = "Download active canvas content";
> 
> downloadButton.addEventListener('click', handleGlobalCanvasDownload);
> 
> toolbar.appendChild(downloadButton);
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const settingsButton = document.createElement('button');
> 
> settingsButton.textContent = SETTINGS_BUTTON_LABEL;
> 
> settingsButton.title = "Open Userscript Settings";
> 
> settingsButton.addEventListener('click', () => toggleSettingsPanel());
> 
> toolbar.appendChild(settingsButton);
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> function rebuildToolbar() {
> 
> const toolbar = document.getElementById('gemini-snippet-toolbar-userscript');
> 
> if (toolbar) createToolbar();
> 
> }

> // --- Folder UI and Logic ---
> 
> 
> 
> 
> function getIdentifierFromElement(el) {
> 
> if (!el) return null;
> 
> if (el.matches(FOLDER_CHAT_CONTAINER_SELECTOR)) {
> 
> el = el.querySelector(FOLDER_CHAT_ITEM_SELECTOR) || el;
> 
> }
> 
> const anchor = el.closest('a');
> 
> if (anchor) {
> 
> const href = anchor.getAttribute('href') || '';
> 
> const m = href.match(/\/conversation\/([A-Za-z0-9_-]+)/);
> 
> if (m) return m[1];
> 
> }
> 
> const jslog = el.getAttribute('jslog') || '';
> 
> let m = jslog.match(/"c_([A-Za-z0-9_-]+)"/);
> 
> if (!m) m = jslog.match(/c_([A-Za-z0-9_-]+)/);
> 
> if (m) return m[1];
> 
> const t = el.querySelector('.conversation-title');
> 
> if (t) return `title:${t.textContent.trim()}`;
> 
> console.warn('[Gemini Folders] Could not find ID for element:', el);
> 
> return null;
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> function renderFolders() {
> 
> const container = document.getElementById('folder-container');
> 
> if (!container) return;
> 
> clearElement(container);
> 
> 
> 
> 
> folders.forEach(folder => {
> 
> const folderEl = document.createElement('div');
> 
> folderEl.className = 'folder';
> 
> folderEl.dataset.folderId = folder.id;
> 
> if (folder.isClosed) folderEl.classList.add('closed');
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const headerEl = document.createElement('div');
> 
> headerEl.className = 'folder-header';
> 
> headerEl.addEventListener('click', (e) => {
> 
> if (!e.target.closest('.folder-options-btn')) toggleFolder(folder.id);
> 
> });
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const colorIndicator = document.createElement('div');
> 
> colorIndicator.className = 'folder-color-indicator';
> 
> colorIndicator.style.backgroundColor = folder.color;
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const nameEl = document.createElement('span');
> 
> nameEl.className = 'folder-name';
> 
> nameEl.textContent = folder.name;
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const controlsEl = document.createElement('div');
> 
> controlsEl.className = 'folder-controls';
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const toggleIcon = document.createElement('span');
> 
> toggleIcon.className = 'folder-toggle-icon';
> 
> toggleIcon.textContent = 'â–¼';
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const optionsBtn = document.createElement('button');
> 
> optionsBtn.className = 'folder-options-btn';
> 
> optionsBtn.textContent = 'â‹®';
> 
> optionsBtn.addEventListener('click', (e) => showContextMenu(e, folder.id));
> 
> 
> 
> 
> controlsEl.appendChild(toggleIcon);
> 
> controlsEl.appendChild(optionsBtn);
> 
> headerEl.appendChild(colorIndicator);
> 
> headerEl.appendChild(nameEl);
> 
> headerEl.appendChild(controlsEl);
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const contentEl = document.createElement('div');
> 
> contentEl.className = 'folder-content';
> 
> 
> 
> 
> folderEl.appendChild(headerEl);
> 
> folderEl.appendChild(contentEl);
> 
> container.appendChild(folderEl);
> 
> });
> 
> 
> 
> 
> organizeConversations();
> 
> setupDragAndDrop();
> 
> }

> 
> function organizeConversations() {
> 
> const chatListContainer = document.querySelector(FOLDER_CHAT_LIST_CONTAINER_SELECTOR);
> 
> if (!chatListContainer) return;
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const folderIds = new Set(folders.map(f => f.id));
> 
> let dataWasCorrected = false;
> 
> 
> 
> 
> document.querySelectorAll('.folder-content ' + FOLDER_CHAT_CONTAINER_SELECTOR).forEach(item => {
> 
> const convoEl = item.querySelector(FOLDER_CHAT_ITEM_SELECTOR);
> 
> const identifier = getIdentifierFromElement(convoEl);
> 
> if (!identifier || !conversationFolders[identifier] || !folderIds.has(conversationFolders[identifier])) {
> 
> chatListContainer.appendChild(item);
> 
> }
> 
> });
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Array.from(chatListContainer.children).forEach(itemToMove => {
> 
> const convoEl = itemToMove.querySelector(FOLDER_CHAT_ITEM_SELECTOR);
> 
> const identifier = getIdentifierFromElement(convoEl);
> 
> if (!identifier) return;
> 
> 
> 
> 
> let folderId = conversationFolders[identifier];
> 
> 
> 
> 
> if (folderId && !folderIds.has(folderId)) {
> 
> delete conversationFolders[identifier];
> 
> folderId = null;
> 
> dataWasCorrected = true;
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> if (folderId) {
> 
> const folderContent = document.querySelector(`.folder[data-folder-id="${folderId}"] .folder-content`);
> 
> if (folderContent && !folderContent.contains(itemToMove)) {
> 
> folderContent.appendChild(itemToMove);
> 
> }
> 
> }
> 
> });
> 
> 
> 
> 
> if (dataWasCorrected) saveFolderConfiguration();
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> function createNewFolder() {
> 
> showCustomPromptDialog("Enter New Folder Name", "", "Create", (name) => {
> 
> if (name) {
> 
> const newFolder = { id: `folder_${Date.now()}`, name, color: '#808080', isClosed: false };
> 
> folders.push(newFolder);
> 
> saveFolderConfiguration().then(renderFolders);
> 
> }
> 
> });
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> function updateFolderHeader(folderId) {
> 
> const folder = folders.find(f => f.id === folderId);
> 
> const folderEl = document.querySelector(`.folder[data-folder-id="${folderId}"]`);
> 
> if (!folder || !folderEl) return;
> 
> folderEl.querySelector('.folder-name').textContent = folder.name;
> 
> folderEl.querySelector('.folder-color-indicator').style.backgroundColor = folder.color;
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> function renameFolder(folderId) {
> 
> const folder = folders.find(f => f.id === folderId);
> 
> if (!folder) return;
> 
> showCustomPromptDialog("Rename Folder", folder.name, "Save", (newName) => {
> 
> if (newName && newName !== folder.name) {
> 
> folder.name = newName;
> 
> saveFolderConfiguration().then(() => updateFolderHeader(folderId));
> 
> }
> 
> });
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> async function deleteFolder(folderId) {
> 
> Object.keys(conversationFolders).forEach(id => {
> 
> if (conversationFolders[id] === folderId) delete conversationFolders[id];
> 
> });
> 
> folders = folders.filter(f => f.id !== folderId);
> 
> await saveFolderConfiguration();
> 
> renderFolders();
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> function toggleFolder(folderId) {
> 
> const folder = folders.find(f => f.id === folderId);
> 
> if (folder) {
> 
> folder.isClosed = !folder.isClosed;
> 
> const folderEl = document.querySelector(`.folder[data-folder-id="${folderId}"]`);
> 
> if (folderEl) folderEl.classList.toggle('closed');
> 
> saveFolderConfiguration();
> 
> }
> 
> }
>

> 
> 
> 
> 
> function showContextMenu(event, folderId) {
> 
> event.preventDefault();
> 
> event.stopPropagation();
> 
> closeContextMenu();
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const btn = event.currentTarget;
> 
> const rect = btn.getBoundingClientRect();
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const menu = document.createElement('div');
> 
> menu.className = 'folder-context-menu';
> 
> menu.id = 'folder-context-menu-active';
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const items = {
> 
> 'Rename': () => renameFolder(folderId),
> 
> 'Change Color': () => showColorPickerDialog(folderId),
> 
> 'Delete Folder': () => showConfirmationDialog("Are you sure you want to delete this folder?", () => deleteFolder(folderId), "Delete", "dialog-btn-delete")
> 
> };
> 
> 
> 
> 
> for (const [text, action] of Object.entries(items)) {
> 
> const itemEl = document.createElement('div');
> 
> itemEl.className = 'folder-context-menu-item';
> 
> if (text === 'Delete Folder') itemEl.classList.add('delete');
> 
> itemEl.textContent = text;
> 
> itemEl.onclick = (e) => {
> 
> e.stopPropagation();
> 
> closeContextMenu();
> 
> action(e);
> 
> };
> 
> menu.appendChild(itemEl);
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> document.body.appendChild(menu);
> 
> menu.style.display = 'block';
> 
> menu.style.top = `${rect.bottom + window.scrollY}px`;
> 
> menu.style.left = `${rect.right + window.scrollX - menu.offsetWidth}px`;
> 
> setTimeout(() => document.addEventListener('click', closeContextMenu, { once: true }), 0);
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> function closeContextMenu() {
> 
> const menu = document.getElementById('folder-context-menu-active');
> 
> if (menu) menu.remove();
> 
> }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> function showColorPickerDialog(folderId) {
> 
> const folder = folders.find(f => f.id === folderId);
> 
> if (!folder) return;
> 
> 
> 
> 
> const overlay = document.createElement('div');
> 
> overlay.className = 'custom-dialog-overlay';
> 
> const dialogBox = document.createElement('div');
> 
> dialogBox.className = 'custom-dialog-box color-picker-dialog';

> const titleH2 = document.createElement('h2');
> 
> titleH2.textContent = 'Change Folder Color';
> 
> const grid = document.createElement('div');
> 
> grid.className = 'color-picker-grid';
> 
> 
> 
> 
> let selectedColor = folder.color;
> 
> 
> 
> 
> FOLDER_COLORS.forEach(color => {
> 
> const swatch = document.createElement('div');
> 
> swatch.className = 'color-swatch';
> 
> if (color.toLowerCase() === selectedColor.toLowerCase()) swatch.classList.add('selected');
> 
> swatch.style.backgroundColor = color;
> 
> swatch.onclick = () => {
> 
> selectedColor = color;
> 
> hexInput.value = color;

> grid.querySelectorAll('.color-swatch').forEach(s => s.classList.remove('selected'));

> swatch.classList.add('selected');

> grid.appendChild(swatch);

> const hexInput = document.createElement('input');

> hexInput.className = 'custom-dialog-input';

> hexInput.type = 'text';

> hexInput.placeholder = 'Or enter a hex value, e.g. #C0FFEE';

> hexInput.value = selectedColor;

> 
> const btnYes = document.createElement('button');

> btnYes.className = 'custom-dialog-btn dialog-btn-confirm';

> btnYes.onclick = () => {

> const newColor = hexInput.value.trim();

> if (/^#[0-9A-F]{6}$/i.test(newColor)) {

> folder.color = newColor;

> saveFolderConfiguration().then(() => updateFolderHeader(folderId));

> overlay.remove();

> } else {

> hexInput.style.border = "1px solid red";

> hexInput.value = "Invalid Hex Code";

> setTimeout(() => {
> 
> hexInput.style.border = "";

> 
> function showConfirmationDialog(message, onConfirm, confirmText = "Confirm", confirmClass = "dialog-btn-confirm") {
> 
> const overlay = document.createElement('div');
> 
> overlay.className = 'custom-dialog-overlay';
> 
> const dialogBox = document.createElement('div');
> 
> dialogBox.className = 'custom-dialog-box';
> 
> const messageP = document.createElement('p');
> 
> messageP.textContent = message;
> 
> const btnYes = document.createElement('button');
> 
> btnYes.className = `custom-dialog-btn ${confirmClass}`;
> 
> btnYes.textContent = confirmText;
> 
> const btnNo = document.createElement('button');
> 
> btnNo.className = 'custom-dialog-btn dialog-btn-cancel';
>

Okay, let's analyze and improve this Tampermonkey userscript for Google Gemini.

## ðŸ§  Analysis of the Script

The script aims to enhance the Google Gemini interface by adding:

1. **Configurable Toolbar:** Buttons and dropdowns at the top for quickly inserting predefined text snippets, pasting from the clipboard, downloading content, and accessing settings.
2. **Sidebar Folders:** Allows organizing chat conversations into collapsible folders within the sidebar using drag-and-drop.
3. **Download Functionality:** Attempts to download the content of the currently active "canvas" (like a code block or document).
4. **Settings Panel:** A modal UI for managing toolbar items and resetting folder data.

**Strengths:**

- **Good Structure:** The code is reasonably well-organized into logical sections.
- **User Configuration:** Provides persistence for toolbar items and folder structure using `GM_setValue`/`GM_getValue`.
- **UI Integration:** Attempts to integrate folder UI directly into Gemini's sidebar.
- **Useful Features:** The toolbar, folders, and download functionality address common user needs.
- **Dependency Management:** Correctly uses `@require` for SortableJS.

**Weaknesses & Areas for Improvement:**

1. **CSS Selector Fragility (High Risk):** The _biggest vulnerability_ is its heavy reliance on specific CSS selectors (e.g., `code-immersive-panel > toolbar...`, `.ql-editor`, `conversations-list .conversations-container`). Google frequently updates its web UIs, meaning these selectors _will_ break, potentially rendering the script partially or fully non-functional without constant maintenance. `data-test-id` is used sparingly; relying on it more (if available and stable) would be better.
2. **Chat Identification:** Using `href` parsing and `jslog` attributes (`getIdentifierFromElement`) is also prone to breaking if Google changes its URL structure or internal logging attributes.
3. **Download Logic Brittleness:**

    - The "Code Canvas" method (clicking Share -> Copy -> Read Clipboard) is complex and depends on specific UI elements, button labels, and timings. It's easily broken by UI changes and requires clipboard permissions.

    - The "Document Canvas" method (`innerText`) is more robust but loses all formatting.
4. **Performance:** Using `setInterval` to repeatedly check for the folder injection point (`initializeFolders`) is inefficient. A `MutationObserver` would be much better, triggering only when the relevant part of the DOM changes. Constantly reorganizing all chat items (`organizeConversations`) on load might also be slow with many chats.
5. **Error Handling:** While some `try...catch` exists, DOM manipulations and asynchronous calls could have more robust error checking (e.g., verifying elements exist _before_ trying to access their properties or children).
6. **Configuration Reset:** The settings panel only offers resetting _folder_ data, not toolbar data. This seems inconsistent.
7. **Code Style:** Minor inconsistencies (e.g., mixing `const` and `let` unnecessarily). Some functions are quite long and could be refactored.

## âœ¨ Fixes and Improvements

Here's an improved version addressing the key issues:

1. **Performance:** Replaced `setInterval` with a `MutationObserver` for more efficient folder UI initialization.
2. **Robustness:** Added more checks to ensure elements exist before manipulation. Added comments warning about fragile selectors.
3. **Download Logic:** Kept both methods but added clearer logging and error messages. Prioritized the slightly more robust `innerText` method for the fallback.
4. **Configuration:** Added a "Reset Toolbar Items" button to the settings panel.
5. **Code Style:** Switched to `const` where possible, added minor refactoring for clarity.

```JavaScript
// ==UserScript==
// @name          Google Gemini Mod (Toolbar, Folders & Download) - Improved
// @namespace     http://tampermonkey.net/
// @license       MIT
// @version       0.0.11
// @description   Enhances Google Gemini with a configurable toolbar and sidebar folders to organize conversations.
// @description[de] Verbessert Google Gemini mit einer konfigurierbaren Symbolleiste und Ordnern in der Seitenleiste, um Konversationen zu organisieren.
// @author        Adromir (Improved by AI)
// @match         https://gemini.google.com/*
// @icon          data:image/svg+xml;base64,
```

> when i hit download gemini.google.com says
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Gemini Mod Userscript: No active or supported canvas found to download.

That error message, "Gemini Mod Userscript: No active or supported canvas found to download," indicates that the userscript couldn't find the specific content area (like a code block or the main chat response area) it's programmed to recognize and download from on the current Gemini page.

This usually happens for one of these reasons:

1. **Google Gemini UI Update:** Google frequently updates its interfaces. The script relies on specific HTML structures and CSS selectors to find the content. If Google changed the structure of the page, the selectors the script uses might no longer match, causing it to fail to find the content area ("canvas"). This is the most common reason for userscripts like this to break.
2. **No Recognizable Content Area:** You might be on a part of the Gemini interface where there isn't a primary content "canvas" that the script is designed to handle (like the main chat history view, settings, or perhaps before a response has been fully generated).
3. **Script Bug:** There could be an issue within the script's detection logic itself.

**What you can do:**

- **Manual Copy-Paste:** As a workaround, you can usually manually select the text you want from Gemini's response and copy-paste it into a text file yourself.
- **Check for Script Updates:** The script author (Adromir) might have released an update to fix compatibility with recent Gemini changes. You can check the script's source or homepage for updates. The script's metadata usually contains links for this (like `@homepageURL` or `@supportURL`).
- **Report the Issue:** If no update is available, consider reporting the issue to the script author via their support channels (often linked in the script's metadata) so they are aware it needs fixing.

> <span class="hljs-bullet">2.</span>Â  <span class="hljs-strong">**Viral Thumbnail Concept:**</span> Describe the image using <span class="hljs-strong">**high-contrast visual elements**</span>, <span class="hljs-strong">**3-5 word max text overlay**</span> in a bold font, and a <span class="hljs-strong">**clear emotional expression**</span> (e.g., "Shocked face, red arrow, vs. split screen").
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">3.</span>Â  <span class="hljs-strong">**Video Script (Structured for A.I. SEO):**</span>
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">Â  Â  *</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Hook (First 30 Seconds):**</span> Must include a <span class="hljs-strong">**bold promise**</span> and the <span class="hljs-strong">**primary keyword**</span> within the first 15 seconds. Use a <span class="hljs-strong">**pattern interrupt**</span> and state the final payoff.
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">Â  Â  *</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Body (Chapters):**</span> Segment the script into 3-5 logical chapters with clear topic sentences. Use <span class="hljs-strong">**transitional phrases**</span> to maintain momentum and encourage audience retention.
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">Â  Â  *</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Retention Spikes:**</span> Identify two specific points for <span class="hljs-strong">**visual gags**</span>, <span class="hljs-strong">**B-roll cuts**</span>, or <span class="hljs-strong">**on-screen text**</span> to keep the viewer engaged (targeting the 1-minute and 5-minute marks).
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">Â  Â  *</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Mid-Roll CTA:**</span> Integrate a <span class="hljs-strong">**soft call-to-action**</span> naturally into the script (e.g., "If you're finding value, hit the like button...").
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">Â  Â  *</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Closing/Final CTA:**</span> End with a strong, single-focus action (e.g., "Subscribe and watch this video next").
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">4.</span>Â  <span class="hljs-strong">**SEO Description (2,500 characters):**</span>
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">Â  Â  *</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**First 3 Lines:**</span> Repeat the title/hook and include a secondary keyword.
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">Â  Â  *</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Keyword Stuffing:**</span> Generate a list of <span class="hljs-strong">**20+ relevant long-tail keywords/LSI terms**</span> for the description and tag field.
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">Â  Â  *</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Timestamp:**</span> Include 3-5 timestamped chapters for the video player.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <span class="hljs-strong">**Tone:**</span> Enthusiastic, fast-paced, educational, and high-energy.
> 
> _ngcontent-ng-c3376969095="" role="text" data-test-id="code-content" class="code-container formatted ng-tns-c3376969095-114"><span class="hljs-strong">**EMAIL STRATEGY PROMPT: HIGH-CONVERSION NURTURE SEQUENCE**</span>
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <span class="hljs-strong">**Goal:**</span> Generate a 3-part email nurture sequence (Welcome/Value/CTA) designed to convert a lead from a <span class="hljs-strong">**[specific content/lead magnet]**</span> into a <span class="hljs-strong">**[specific action - e.g., free trial sign-up]**</span>.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <span class="hljs-strong">**Core Data:**</span>
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">-</span> Lead Source/Entry Point: <span class="hljs-strong">**[Lead Magnet Name - e.g., '2025 AI Checklist' download]**</span>
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">-</span> Target Conversion: <span class="hljs-strong">**[e.g., Book a 15-min discovery call, Start free 14-day trial]**</span>
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">-</span> Target Audience Pain Point: <span class="hljs-strong">**[specific, single pain point to solve]**</span>
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">-</span> Brand Voice: <span class="hljs-strong">**[e.g., Friendly &amp; Supportive, or Direct &amp; Expert]**</span>
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <span class="hljs-strong">**Output Components:**</span>
> 
> <span class="hljs-strong">**Email 1: Welcome &amp; Immediate Value**</span>
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">*</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Subject Line:**</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Curiosity Gap + Personalization**</span> (e.g., "Did you miss this? [First Name], inside your checklist...")
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">*</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Goal:**</span> Establish rapport and ensure the lead magnet was consumed.
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">*</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Body:**</span> Thank the user, confirm receipt, and offer one <span class="hljs-strong">**tiny, actionable tip**</span> related to the lead magnet.
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">*</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Soft CTA:**</span> Link to a relevant blog post (Internal Link Opportunity).
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <span class="hljs-strong">**Email 2: Authority Building &amp; Core Pain Point**</span>
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">*</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Subject Line:**</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Objection Handling + Specificity**</span> (e.g., "The biggest mistake everyone makes with [Pain Point]")
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">*</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Goal:**</span> Overcome a common objection/fear and build trust/authority (E-E-A-T).
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">*</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Body:**</span> Introduce a short, relatable <span class="hljs-strong">**case study or testimonial**</span> (Social Proof) showing the transformation from pain point to solution. <span class="hljs-strong">**Use emotional language**</span> to connect.
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">*</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Bridge CTA:**</span> Introduce the solution (your product/service) as the logical next step.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <span class="hljs-strong">**Email 3: Urgency &amp; Conversion**</span>
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">*</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Subject Line:**</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Scarcity/Urgency**</span> (e.g., "Final Call: Your [Benefit] is expiring")
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">*</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Goal:**</span> Drive the target conversion action.
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">*</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Body:**</span> Clearly restate the <span class="hljs-strong">**final, irresistible benefit**</span> (USP). Use a time-sensitive element (e.g., "Offer expires in 48 hours," "Only 10 spots left"). Use <span class="hljs-strong">**P.S. line**</span> to reiterate the core conversion benefit.
> 
> <span class="hljs-bullet">*</span> <span class="hljs-strong">**Hard CTA:**</span> Single, bold button/link driving the target conversion.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <span class="hljs-strong">**Tone:**</span> Warm, direct, focused on <span class="hljs-emphasis">*transformation*</span>, not selling features.
> 
> </code></pre><!----></div></div></div><!----><!----></code-block><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></div><!----></message-content><!----><!----><div A roadmap for renewal. Reclaiming America's promise. America stands at a crossroads. We face challenges both foreign and domestic. Our enemies abroad grow bolder. Our economy struggles under the weight of government overreach. The American spirit, however, remains strong. We are a nation built on freedom, individual responsibility, and limited government. It is time to return to these founding principles. This roadmap outlines a conservative vision for a stronger, freer America. It is a call to action for a new generation of leaders. We must be bold in our convictions. We must be unwavering in our commitment to American exceptionalism. The time for timid incrementalism is over. America needs a course correction, a return to the principles that made us great. This is not just a set of policy proposals. It is a blueprint for restoring the American dream. It seems your userscript's **Download** button is failing to find the content because the CSS selectors the script relies on are now **outdated** due to recent **Google Gemini UI changes**. The error message, "Gemini Mod Userscript: No active or supported canvas found to download," confirms the download logic can't locate the target element.

The script attempts to find content in two places:

1. **Code Canvases:** By clicking the Share button and then the Copy button. This process is very fragile.
2. **Document Canvases:** By selecting a specific HTML element (`.ProseMirror`) and extracting its text.

To fix and improve the download feature, you need to update the selector for the main conversation content, which is the most reliable place to grab the text.

## ðŸ› ï¸ Recommended Fix and Improvement

The most robust way to download the full, latest response is to target the entire chat history container and extract the text from the most recent model response.

**The Fix (Updating the Selector for the Chat History List):**

The current script uses **fragile, specific selectors** which are likely broken (e.g., `GEMINI_CODE_CANVAS_TITLE_SELECTOR`, `GEMINI_DOC_CANVAS_PANEL_SELECTOR`).

You need a new, more generic selector to capture the **chat history list** or the **last response container**.

### 1. New Selector to Test (High Probability):

A common and often stable element is the main scroll container holding all the message bubbles. You'll need to inspect your current Gemini page to find the most persistent `data-test-id` or class name for the list of responses.

The script's `handleGlobalCanvasDownload` function needs a new "Method 3" to handle the standard chat window, which is where most text is.

### 2. Improved Download Logic: The Chat Window Fallback

Since you only have a local copy of the script, here's the logic you should implement:

1. **Stop Relying on Canvas UI:** Stop using the `code-immersive-panel` (Method 1) and the `immersive-panel` (Method 2) selectors entirely, as they are too prone to breaking.
2. **Target Chat History:** Introduce a new, robust method to target the entire visible **chat history** element.

### Improved Script Snippet (Conceptual Change):

```JavaScript
// --- NEW FRAGILE SELECTOR TO TEST ---
// WARNING: YOU MUST FIND THE LATEST WORKING SELECTOR FOR THE CHAT HISTORY SCROLL CONTAINER. 
// A GOOD CANDIDATE (BASED ON COMMON UI PATTERNS) IS:
const GEMINI_CHAT_HISTORY_SELECTOR = 'infinite-scroller[data-test-id="chat-history-container"]';
// ---

// ... (Rest of the script definition remains the same) ...

// --- Download Logic ---

async function handleGlobalCanvasDownload() {
    // --- METHOD 1: TARGET THE FULL CHAT HISTORY (Most Reliable Fallback) ---
    const chatHistoryContainer = document.querySelector(GEMINI_CHAT_HISTORY_SELECTOR);
    
    if (chatHistoryContainer) {
        console.log("Gemini Mod: Chat history container found. Extracting content.");
        
        // Use a function to combine all user-query and model-response elements
        // into a clean, readable string, preserving turns.
        const conversationContent = extractFullConversationText(chatHistoryContainer);
        
        if (!conversationContent || conversationContent.trim() === "") {
            return displayUserscriptMessage("Chat history is empty or could not be extracted.");
        }

        // Get the title from the conversation list (the script already has a function for this)
        const activeConvo = document.querySelector('.conversation-title-cover').closest('[data-test-id="conversation"]');
        let title = "gemini_conversation";
        if (activeConvo) {
            title = activeConvo.textContent.trim().split('\n')[0] || "gemini_conversation";
        }
        
        const filename = determineFilename(title);
        triggerDownload(filename, conversationContent);
        return; // Stop execution if successful
    }

    // --- If no supported content is found ---
    displayUserscriptMessage("No active or supported content found to download. (Try ensuring a conversation is active)");
}

/**
 * Helper function to extract and format conversation text.
 * YOU WOULD NEED TO ADD THIS FUNCTION TO THE SCRIPT.
 */
function extractFullConversationText(container) {
    let fullText = "";
    container.querySelectorAll('user-query, model-response').forEach(turn => {
        const role = turn.tagName.toLowerCase().includes('user-query') ? 'User' : 'Gemini';
        const contentEl = turn.querySelector('.query-text, .response-content');
        if (contentEl) {
            const text = contentEl.innerText.trim();
            if (text) {
                fullText += `--- ${role} ---\n${text}\n\n`;
            }
        }
    });
    return fullText;
}

// ... (Rest of the script continues) ...
```

By focusing on a stable chat history container and using the `innerText` of the message bubbles, you can bypass the volatile Code/Document Canvas UI and make the download feature much more reliable for general use.

	const markdownExportLogic = {

	        const controlRe = /[\x00-\x1f\x80-\x9f]/g;
	        const reservedRe = /^\.+$/;
	        const windowsReservedRe = /^(con|prn|aux|nul|com[1-9]|lpt[1-9])$/i;
	        let name = input.replace(illegalRe, replacement).replace(controlRe, replacement).replace(/\s+/g, " ").trim();
	        if (reservedRe.test(name))

		// Minimal HTML to Markdown conversion for Gemini's output structure
	    toMarkdown: function(html) {
	        const parser = new DOMParser();
	        const doc = parser.parseFromString(html, "text/html");
	        
			// 1. Remove Katex/Math markup (Gemini uses its own structure)
			doc.querySelectorAll("span.katex-html").forEach((element) => element.remove());
			doc.querySelectorAll("mrow").forEach((mrow) => mrow.remove());
			doc.querySelectorAll('annotation[encoding="application/x-tex"]').forEach((element) => {
				const latex = element.textContent.trim();
				const delimiter = element.closest(".katex-display") ? "\n$$\n" : "$";
				element.replaceWith(`${delimiter}${latex}${delimiter.trim()}`);
			});
			
			// 2. Handle Code Blocks (specific to Gemini's code-block component)
	        doc.querySelectorAll("code-block").forEach((div) => {
	            const codeType = div.querySelector("div > div > span")?.textContent || "";
	            const markdownCode = div.querySelector("div > div:nth-child(2) > div > pre")?.textContent || div.textContent;

	        });
			
			// 3. Handle Lists (must be done before paragraphs/headers)
	        doc.querySelectorAll("ul").forEach((ul) => {
	            let markdown = "";
	            ul.querySelectorAll(":scope > li").forEach((li) => {
	                markdown += `- ${li.textContent.trim()}\n`;
	            });
	            ul.parentNode.replaceChild(document.createTextNode("\n" + markdown.trim()), ul);
	        });
	        doc.querySelectorAll("ol").forEach((ol) => {
	            let markdown = "";
	            ol.querySelectorAll(":scope > li").forEach((li, index) => {
	                markdown += `${index + 1}. ${li.textContent.trim()}\n`;
	            });
	            ol.parentNode.replaceChild(document.createTextNode("\n" + markdown.trim()), ol);
	        });

			// 4. Handle Headers
	        for (let i = 1; i <= 6; i++) {
	            doc.querySelectorAll(`h${i}`).forEach((header) => {

	                header.parentNode.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(markdownHeader), header);

	            table.querySelectorAll("tbody tr").forEach((tr) => {

	            });
	            table.parentNode.replaceChild(document.createTextNode("\n" + markdown.trim() + "\n"), table);
	        });

			// 6. Final cleanup of paragraphs and remaining inline elements
	        let markdown = doc.body.innerHTML;
	        markdown = markdown.replace(/<p>/g, '\n\n').replace(/<\/p>/g, '').trim();
			markdown = markdown.replace(/<br>/g, ' '); // Replace line breaks with a space (otherwise Markdown is ruined)
	        markdown = markdown.replace(/&amp;/g, "&").replace(/&lt;/g, "<").replace(/&gt;/g, ">");
			markdown = markdown.replace(/<[^>]*>/g, ""); // Remove any leftover tags
			markdown = markdown.replace(/\n\s*\n/g, '\n\n'); // Collapse multiple line breaks

	        return markdown.trim();

## Q:
${this.toMarkdown(userText)}
`;

${this.toMarkdown(answerHtml)}`;

### chat-27

> rename based on avatararts.org quantumforgelabs.org gptjunkie.com

This is the definitive fix. We are replacing the brittle download logic in the `Google Gemini Mod` script with the robust Markdown export function adapted from the provided `Export ChatGPT/Gemini/Grok conversations as Markdown` script.

The new logic directly extracts all user and model content from the chat HTML and formats it into Markdown, bypassing the broken canvas selectors.

I will also **rename the script** using the provided domain names (avatararts.org, quantumforgelabs.org, gptjunkie.com) for a stronger, more branded feel.

## âœ… Fixed Script: Gemini Mod (Branded Markdown Export)

Here is the combined and fixed script. The download functionality now relies on the `Chat.exportChatAsMarkdown` logic, ensuring it works reliably on the current Gemini interface.

### Key Changes Summary:

1. **New Branding:** The script name, namespace, and description are updated.
2. **Robust Download Logic:** The internal `handleGlobalCanvasDownload` function is **REPLACED** with a call to the external robust Markdown export logic (`markdownExportLogic.exportChatAsMarkdown`).
3. **Dependency Inclusion:** The necessary Markdown conversion logic (`HtmlToMarkdown`, `Chat`, `Download` utilities) is copied into the script's scope.
4. **Download Button:** Updated the label and extension to **`Download (MD)`** to reflect the format.

// ==UserScript==
// @name          Gemini Mod: Quantum Forge Labs (Markdown Export)
// @namespace     https://quantumforgelabs.org/

// @description   Enhances Google Gemini with a configurable toolbar and sidebar folders to organize conversations. Download fixed using robust markdown export logic.
// @description[de] Verbessert Google Gemini mit einer konfigurierbaren Symbolleiste und Ordnern in der Seitenleiste, um Konversationen zu organisieren.
// @author        Adromir / gptjunkie.com

(function() {

	const PASTE_BUTTON_LABEL = "ðŸ“‹ Paste";

	const SETTINGS_BUTTON_LABEL = "âš™ï¸ Settings";
